record.darwin:Remarks: The denticles are exceedingly small and not spade-shaped, as in larger specimens of S. cubensis, but have 3 sharp points, the middle one extending much beyond the laterals. There are very slight hints of lateral lobes on either side of the central point. The snout/nostril versus nostril/lip ratio is the reverse of the larger specimens of S. cubensis. They have sharply blackened dorsal fins on the distal halfs which is supposed to be a S. cubensis trait but perhaps juvenile S. mitsukurii have them too?? - Wayne C. Starnes, 2007.

record.darwin:Remarks: The dry specimens are scales and they are from specimens that were Pit tagged and released. A few of the specimens were not Pit tagged. The corresponding Pit tag/ID numbers are: 0A00072168, male, 353 mm SL, 428 mm TL, 780 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 0A00072626, male, 344 mm SL, 421 mm TL, 760 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 0A00072806, male, 343 mm SL, 419 mm TL, 690 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 0A00073354, male, 382 mm SL, 452 mm TL, 910 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 0A00074736, male, 354 mm SL, 425 mm TL, 660 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 0A00077166, female, 334 mm SL, 403 mm TL, 650 g, loss of mucus, spent; 0A00077508, male, 366 mm SL, 443 mm TL, 930 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 0A00080547, male, 350 mm SL, 416 mm TL, 580 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 0A00080636, female, 351 mm SL, 420 mm TL, weight n/k, loss of mucus, spent; 0A00085119, female, 352 mm SL, 421 mm TL, 810 g, no loss of mucus, gravid; 0A00086928, female, 368 mm SL, 427 mm TL, 790 g, no visible signs of condtion, gravid; 200404131, male, 397 mm SL, 473 mm TL, 870 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 200404132, male, 371 mm SL, 434 mm TL, 840 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 200404133, female, 416 mm SL, 490 mm TL, 1250 g, loss of mucus, ripe and running. The scales are separated within the bag by the last 5 digits of the Pit tag number or by their ID numbers.
